intro: Machaeranthera hansonii, commonly known as the Hanson's blazingstar, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun, making it well adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branching. Machaeranthera hansonii is often found in prairies and open woodlands, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
